title: Death toll climbs to 10 in Ella bus crash
byline: The death toll from the bus crash near the 24th Km Post on the Ella-Wellawaya main road last night (4) has reportedly increased to 10 with over 15 others injured and hospitalized.

title: Cabinet nod to remove concessions granted to MPs to purchase houses from “Viyathpura”
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal to abolish the concessionary payment scheme granted for Members of Parliament to purchase houses from the “Viyathpura” housing complex.

title: Italian fashion designer Giorgio Armani dies aged 91
byline: Italian fashion legend Giorgio Armani, king of a high-end lifestyle empire, has died at the age of 91 “surrounded by his loved ones”, his company said Thursday.

title: Death toll from Afghan earthquake jumps to 2,205 as aid agencies plead for funds
byline: Hundreds of bodies have been recovered from houses destroyed by a major earthquake in Afghanistan last week, pushing the death toll to over 2,200, a Taliban government spokesman said Thursday.

title: 16 Eastern University students arrested over ragging incident
byline: A total of sixteen students, including six females students, have been arrested in connection with an alleged ragging incident at the Eastern University.

title: Google services were down in Turkey, parts of Europe
byline: Some Google services including YouTube temporarily went down on Thursday in Turkey and some parts of Europe including Greece and Germany, according to a Turkish deputy minister, internet monitors and users in the regions.

title: Wife of ‘Backhoe Saman’ remanded until September 18
byline: The wife of underworld figure ‘Backhoe Saman’, Shadhika Lakshani, who is currently in custody, has been remanded until September 18 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Instagram launches iPad App with reels at the center, aims to challenge TikTok
byline: Instagram launched a dedicated iPad application on Wednesday, placing its short-form video feature Reels at the center of the redesigned interface as parent company Meta intensifies competition with TikTok.

title: 2 dead, 12 injured as bus topples down precipice on Ella-Wellawaya road
byline: (UPDATED) At least two persons are reported dead while another 12 individuals have been injured and hospitalised after a bus toppled down a precipice near the 24th Km Post on the Ella-Weelawaya main road.

title: 44 complaints related to teenage pregnancies lodged in first seven months of 2025
byline: The National Child Protection Authority states that 44 complaints related to teenage pregnancies have been received during the first seven months of this year.

title: India makes ACs, tea, school supplies cheaper to mitigate shock of US tariffs
byline: India has cut taxes on hundreds of goods to boost consumption and mitigate the potential impact of steep US tariffs.

title: Appeals Court issues interim order suspending trial against retired SDIG Ravi Seneviratne
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued an interim injunction suspending the ongoing trial at the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court against Retired Senior Deputy Inspector General Ravi Seneviratne, who is currently serving as the Secretary to the Ministry of Public Security.

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa further remanded
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, has been further remanded until September 18 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Case against ex-Ministers Mahindananda and Nalin Fernando adjourned to October 10
byline: The case filed under the Public Property Act against former ministers Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando and the former Secretary of the Ministry of Sports, retired Major General Nanda Mallawaarachchi has been scheduled for further hearing on October 10 at the Colombo High Court.

title: Sri Lanka and Italy sign MoU on political consultations mechanism
byline: The first round of Political Consultations between Sri Lanka and Italy, co-chaired by Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment Arun Hemachandra and Italy’s Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation Maria Tripodi, ...

title: Nine-hour water cut in Colombo and suburbs
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced a nine-hour water cut, scheduled from 10:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. on Saturday (06), affecting several areas including Colombo.

title: VAT on digital services by non-residents deferred to April 2026
byline: The implementation of the decision to introduce an 18% Value Added Tax (VAT) on digital services provided by non-resident companies to local consumers, effective October 2025 has been deferred to next year.

title: Sri Lanka’s official reserves increase marginally in August
byline: Sri Lanka’s official reserve assets have increased marginally by 0.3% to USD 6.166 billion in August 2025, compared to USD 6.147 billion in July 2025, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Russian woman arrested for operating business while on tourist visa
byline: A 29-year-old Russian woman has been arrested by the Unawatuna Tourist Police Unit for allegedly engaging in business activities while residing in Sri Lanka on a tourist visa.

title: Prime Minister Harini calls for unity and compassion on Milad-un-Nabi
byline: Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has extended her greetings on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Prophet Muhammad, widely observed by Muslim communities around the world as Milad-un-Nabi.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: A few showers may occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy, Nuwara Eliya, and Jaffna districts, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: President calls for brotherhood, peace, and compassion on Milad-un-Nabi
byline: President of Sri Lanka, Anura Kumara Dissanayake has extended his greetings on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Prophet Muhammad, observed by Muslim communities around the world as Milad-un-Nabi.

title: Ella Bus Accident: Death toll rises to 15, several injured
byline: The death toll from the bus crash near the 24th Km Post on the Ella-Wellawaya main road last night (4) has reportedly increased to 15.

title: SUV driver arrested following tragic bus accident in Ella
byline: The driver of the SUV vehicle involved in the collision with a bus in Ella has been arrested, police confirmed.

title: SLAF helicopters on standby to assist victims of Ella bus accident
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has deployed an MI-17 helicopter at SLAF CTS Diyatalawa and a Bell 412 helicopter at SLAF Station Weerawila which have been placed on standby to provide assistance in response to the bus accident that occurred last night (04) on the Ella–Wellawaya road.

title: Trump to rebrand Pentagon as Department of War
byline: US President Donald Trump is directing that the Department of Defense be known as the Department of War.

title: Ella bus crash: 12 Tangalle UC employees including Secretary among victims
byline: Fifteen individuals, including the Tangalle Urban Council Secretary, 12 council employees, two children, and the bus driver, have been reported dead following a tragic bus accident on the Ella–Wellawaya main road last night, Deputy Minister of Local Government Ruwan Senarath confirmed.

title: Indian national arrested with Kush worth Rs. 105 mln at BIA
byline: An Indian national passenger attempting to smuggle a consignment of “Kush” cannabis, valued at Rs. 105 million, through the “Green Channel” (undeclared) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) has been arrested by a group of airport customs officials this morning (05).

title: Trump signs order to cut tariffs on Japanese cars to 15%
byline: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday that cuts tariffs on Japanese car imports from 27.5% to 15%, easing uncertainty for motor industry giants like Toyota, Honda and Nissan.

title: Sri Lanka to protect fish resources in 250 reservoirs
byline: The Sri Lankan government has approved a proposal to install barrier nets in 250 permanent freshwater reservoirs in two years to prevent the loss of fish stock and increase inland fish production, a statement by the Department of Government Information said on Thursday.

title: Nine-hour water cut in Colombo and suburbs cancelled
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced that the nine-hour water cut, originally scheduled from 10:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. tomorrow (06), affecting several areas including Colombo, has been cancelled.

title: Roshan Mahanama resigns from National Sports Council
byline: Former Sri Lanka cricketer Roshan Mahanama has stepped down from his role as a member of the National Sports Council (NSC), with immediate effect, citing personal reasons.

title: Three-wheeler plunges down precipice in Watawala: Woman and 2 children injured
byline: A three-wheeler travelling from Gampola to Hatton has veered off the road and plunged down a 50-foot precipice in the Watawala area injuring three persons including two children.

title: Thai lawmakers to vote for a new prime minister as candidates promise an early election
byline: Thai lawmakers met to select a new prime minister Friday as major parties made competing promises to soon dissolve Parliament and call an election as a way to resolve the country’s political crisis.

title: Thailand’s Anutin Charnvirakul elected PM by parliament
byline: Thailand’s Anutin Charnvirakul was elected prime minister on Friday after breezing through a parliamentary vote, trouncing the candidate of the Shinawatra family’s once-dominant ruling party to end a week of chaos and political deadlock. NORE..

title: Cause of Ella bus accident? – Survivor reveals driver’s warning of brake fault
byline: Police stated that initial investigations into the Ella bus accident revealed that the crash occurred due to the bus traveling at excessive speed and the driver losing control.
